intro: Saccolabiopsis pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf saccolabiopsis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and swampy areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are often clustered at the base, forming a low-growing rosette. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually appearing in late spring or early summer. Saccolabiopsis pusilla is a member of the Cyperaceae family, commonly known as the sedge family.
